title: Parallax Zoom Animation
description: A visual effect where objects zoom at varying speeds during changes in viewpoint, creating depth and immersion.

body.raw:
## Installation Install the following dependencies: ```bash pnpm add framer-motion clsx tailwind-merge ``` Add util file on `lib/utils.ts` ```tsx import { ClassValue, clsx } from "clsx"; import { twMerge } from "tailwind-merge"; export function cn(...inputs: ClassValue[]) { return twMerge(clsx(inputs)); } ``` Copy and paste the following code into your project. ## Usage To use the zoom-parallax component, import it into your project. If you've created your component in a specific directory, such as `@/registry/animations/source/zoom-paralax-animation`, ensure to reference its location accordingly during import. ```tsx import ZoomParalaxAnimation from "@/registry/animations/source/zoom-paralax-animation"; ``` To statically import the images, ensure they are included in your project's file structure. Then, create an array containing the images to be used within your application. ```tsx // static import the images import Picture1 from "@/public/zoomParalax/picture1.jpg"; import Picture2 from "@/public/zoomParalax/picture2.avif"; import Picture8 from "@/public/zoomParalax/picture8.avif"; import Picture4 from "@/public/zoomParalax/picture4.avif"; import Picture5 from "@/public/zoomParalax/picture5.avif"; import Picture6 from "@/public/zoomParalax/picture6.avif"; import Picture7 from "@/public/zoomParalax/picture7.avif"; // create a array of images const pictures = [ Picture1, Picture2, Picture8, Picture4, Picture5, Picture6, Picture7, ]; ``` The provided code snippet is an example of how to integrate the ZoomParallaxAnimation component into a React application. 1. Enclose the component within a `
` tag for structural organization. 2. Inside a `
` element with class "my-64" (which presumably applies styling), include the ZoomParallaxAnimation component. 3. Pass the array of pictures (presumably containing image data) to the `pictures` prop of the ZoomParallaxAnimation component. This setup allows for the incorporation of the ZoomParallaxAnimation component, showcasing a series of pictures with parallax zoom effects within the designated section of the application. ```tsx
```
